Labeling justification in details: The single Spring Boot deployment owns owner self-service flows, pet lifecycle management, visit booking, and veterinary directory endpoints in the same module. OwnerController handles owner CRUD, PetController mutates pets under the same repository, VisitController coordinates visit creation by directly persisting owner aggregates, and VetController publishes vet listings, demonstrating multiple bounded contexts collapsed into one service instead of separate modules or services.

Code Line(s): OwnerController:L73-L175; PetController:L99-L158; VisitController:L84-L101; VetController:L44-L75; CrashController:L31-L34; WelcomeController:L25-L27
Labeling justification in details: All HTTP handlers are mounted directly at root-level paths such as /owners, /pets, /vets, /owners/{ownerId}/pets/{petId}/visits/new, /oups, and /. No URI version segment or media-type negotiation is implemented, preventing the team from running v1 and v2 APIs concurrently and forcing breaking changes onto consumers.
